lexUnit.name: whisker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long projecting hair or bristle growing from the face or snout of an animal such as a cat

sentence.text: His tongue had not been cut out -- it loomed thick and purple behind those savage teeth and the thick whiskers of severed whip -- however his throat was dry as dust .
This he had learnt from Ann herself , who had forecast the sex of both babies by means of a golden ring suspended by the longest whisker of a white cat .
Apparently he was setting out to grow whiskers of the latest fashion , for his lips were carefully shaved .
He grinned and stroked his whiskers .
Properly done , this prevents the ferret from opening its mouth , but care must be taken to make sure that the animal 's whiskers are neither disturbed nor disarranged .
" I 'll kill him , " repeated Bigwig , spluttering through his fouled whiskers and clotted fur .
Fox , with his assistants , was searching the whole area and no rabbit would have ventured to show its whiskers .
Omally grinned handsomely beneath his whiskers .
Mr Kobold brushed cakey fragments from his side whiskers .
Still uncertain of what tone to adopt , the campaigners brought six people dressed as Santa Claus , including , incognito behind his cottonwool whiskers , one Greenpeace Santa .
His side whiskers were magnificent .
Mr Kobold brushed cakey fragments from his side whiskers .
Marsh examined a number of whiskers in the electron microscope and found that , for the substances he was using , the root radii of the growth-steps was roughly constant at about 40 ngstr NN2 .
It proves nothing of the sort , " thought the Magistrate , stroking his cinnamon whiskers with excitement that bordered on ecstasy .
Springsteen finished the mince and inspected his whiskers for any he 'd missed .
Ruth wondered if she was gazing at the dark whiskers which sprouted on her chin and made her so appropriately , though unfortunately , named .
The one person amongst them who did n't move back was the young man with the whiskers and the private placard of his own .
A tall , haughty man with luxuriant black whiskers and beard , he wore a formal uniform of horizon blue trimmed elaborately with gold .
We crowded round the table , straining our ears for the magic sounds , while Robert adjusted the cat 's whisker .
His iron-grey hair was parted in the middle and he had the mutton-chop whiskers of a bygone age .
His dark hair was thinning on top , but he had bushy side whiskers as if it had all slipped downwards , and his chin was a dimpled mound seeming to support an ever-smiling mouth .
Some have fleshy whiskers half as long as their bodies which they project forward and wave about , like a blind person with a stick .
